title: Problems of the Italian school system 2019
summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 26.0 is found at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and the minimum is found at Others where Response is 2.0.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 24.0.
min_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market has the highest Share of respondents and Others has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 26.0 is found at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and the minimum is found at Others where Response is 2.0.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 24.0.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market and lowest at Response Others.
The Share of respondents of Response Others is 13.0% smaller than the maximum value at Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market.

Response Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market is higher than any other Responses with value 26.0, followed by Lack of funding and resources, and Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students. Down to Response Others with the lowest value 2.0.
Response Bad teachers, and Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students share the same value 13.0.
The Response Others tends to be 2.34 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 100.0.

data.Response: Lack of opportunities to enter into the labor market
Lack of financial aid for low-income families and students
